home.title: Project GECO
home.desc: Help team leaders establish and maintain productive group dynamics by becoming better facilitators

catalogue.title: Check In
catalogue.subtitle: 5-15 minutes | 2-20 members
catalogue.description: Start your meetings right by giving each team member the space to share something with the team.

catalogue.title: Start-Stop-Continue
catalogue.subtitle: 30-45 minutes | 2-20 members
catalogue.description: Improve the way you work as a team. Share what works well and what needs to improve to collaborate more effectively going forward.

catalogue.title: Check Out
catalogue.subtitle: 5-15 minutes | 2-20 members
catalogue.description: End your meetings right by giving each team member the space to share something with the team.

catalogue.title: Tutorial to me
catalogue.subtitle: 5-15 minutes | 2-20 members
catalogue.description: End your meetings right by giving each team member the space to share something with the team.

checkIn.title: Check In Exercise
checkIn.subtitle: 5-15 minutes | 2-20 members
checkIn.description: Check Ins are activities that help facilitators gather insights into the current thoughts or emotions of each group member. These can range from simple to more in-dept activities, such as, thumbs Up/thumbs Down, feelings check in, rate my day.
questions: If you could describe your current state of mind in three words, what would they be?
What's one thing you're looking forward to this week?
If you were a weather phenomenon, what would you be today and why?
What's one small win you've had recently?
If you could have any superpower for just today, what would it be?
What's one thing you've learned in the past week?
If your mood was a color right now, what color would it be?
What's one thing you're grateful for today?
If you could teleport anywhere for your next break, where would you go?
What's one goal you're working towards right now?
What is a pleasure you maybe shouldn’t do but can’t resist doing?

checkOut.title: Check Out Exercise
checkOut.subtitle: 5-15 minutes | 2-20 members
checkOut.description: Check Outs are used to close out a session and recap the experience. They help participants reflect on the entire session and express any final thoughts or feelings. Examples include; what was your biggest takeaway from todays session?, what would you like to see more or less of? show some appreciation to someone in this group who has inspired or supported you today, what next step do you plan to take?
questions: In two words… how was the experience from the session today?
In one word… tell us how you are  feeling at the moment
Think of three things that highlight this session
Tell us one fun thing about the session!
In one sentence…tell us what's your concern today

passItOn.title: Pass It On Method
steps: Pick a person to answer the question first.
Once that person gave their answer, they pick who should answer next.
Continue this process until everyone has answered the question.

about.title: Start-Stop-Continue Exercise
about.subtitle: Reflect and Improve
about.description: The Start, Stop, Continue (SSC) exercise is a feedback technique that helps people and teams reflect on what activities they should start, stop, or continue doing. It can be used for a variety of purposes, such as, create a framework for feedback, encourage new ideas, focus on action and collaboration, and promote broader thinking.

start.title: Chapter 1: Start
start.subtitle: 4-5 minutes | 2-20 members
start.description: In this chapter, you will brainstorm and discuss what are the things you could start doing as a community to better support the productivity, communication, etc. Give an example of how this might help you and the community to thrive.

steps.title: Start
steps.description: What should we start doing to work better together?

steps.title: Silent Brainstorm
steps.description: Everyone writes down one thing the team should start doing. You have three minutes to brainstorm silently

steps.title: Review & Discussion
steps.description: Go around the room and present the one thing everyone wrote down.

steps.title: Proritize
steps.description: Group similar suggestions. Let members place one “dot” on the suggestion they agree with most.

stop.title: Chapter 2: Stop
stop.subtitle: 4-5 minutes | 2-20 members
stop.description: In this chapter, you will brainstorm and discuss what are the things you should stop doing as a community to better support the productivity, communication, etc. Give an example of how this point might help you and the community to thrive.

steps.title: Stop
steps.description: What should we stop doing to work better together?

steps.title: Silent Brainstorm
steps.description: Everyone writes down one thing the team should stop doing. You have three minutes to brainstorm silently.

steps.title: Review & Discussion
steps.description: Go around the room and present the one thing everyone wrote down.

steps.title: Proritize
steps.description: Group similar suggestions. Let members place one “dot” on the suggestion they agree with most.

continue.title: Chapter 3: Continue
continue.subtitle: 4-5 minutes | 2-20 members
continue.description: In this chapter, you will brainstorm and discuss what are the things you should continue doing as a community to better support the productivity, communication, etc. Give an example of how this might help you and the community to thrive.

steps.title: Silent Brainstorm
steps.description: Everyone writes down one thing the team should continue doing. You have three minutes to brainstorm silently.

steps.title: Review & Discussion
steps.description: Go around the room and present the one thing everyone wrote down.

steps.title: Proritize
steps.description: Group similar suggestions. Let members place one “dot” on the suggestion they agree with most.

tips.title: GECO App
tips.subtitle: Start-Stop-Continue Exercise: Tips
tips.description: Points to keep it mind when doing the exercise
points: Analyze feedback and create a plan of action

feedback.title: GECO App
feedback.subtitle: Start-Stop-Continue Exercise: Feedback
feedback.description: Have some thoughts, comments and suggestions about the app? Share your thought with us

tutorialToMe.title: Tutorial to me
tutorialToMe.subtitle: 30 minutes | 2-15 people | Multiplayer, Asynchronous
tutorialToMe.description: The 'Tutorial to me' exercise helps your team share their strengths, weaknesses, and preferred ways of communicating when starting to work together. This ensures everyone is aligned on how they like working and how to best collaborate. Team members can refer to the results of this exercise in the 'Team' tab of the GECO app throughout the project.

defineTimeline.title: Define Timeline
defineTimeline.description: Let's set the deadline for the exercise.

steps.title: Strength
steps.description: What three strengths do you bring to a team when working on a project?

steps.title: Weakness
steps.description: What three weaknesses do you have when working on a project?

steps.title: Communication
steps.description: What three communication practices do you value when working on a project?

steps.title: Finish
steps.description: You're done! You can now see the results of the exercise in the 'Team' tab in the GECO app.

feedback.title: What worked well during this exercise?
feedback.subtitle: What didn't?
